intro: Dombeya subviscosa subsp. ihosyensis, commonly known as the Ihosy dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within humid forests. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are dispersed by birds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
